page.title: 09WINCHCOMBE HOSPITAL - Pt.1
page.content: Built in the early 1900's, on a site near to the old Tobacco fields of the 17th Cent.,Winchcombe Hospital was originally a private house owned by Mrs Bird. It first became a hospital in 1926. (6) Today, as a NHS cottage hospital,there are 11 day nurses, 6 night nurses, 7 doctors, 5 domestic staff, 2 cooks and 1 porter. The hospital can look after 22 patients at a time. No children under 13 stay overnight in Winchcombe Hospital, they are transfered to Cheltenham. The hospital has 5 wards with 4 beds in each and 2 single wards.It has a small operating theatre which deals with minor operations. The beds are firm and for long stay patients there are special air-filled mattresses for extra comfort. A well- equipped physiotherapy unit serves Winchcombe and the surrounding area.
